provisions.title: Software Provider Review, Termination and Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Settling Defendant must review existing and prospective Software Providers for prohibited conduct, suspend or terminate non-compliant providers, and maintain records of all reviews and actions taken.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment
provisions.summary: A monetary judgment of $25,000,000 is entered against Settling Defendant, to be paid to the FTC within 14 days of entry of the Order by electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Settling Defendant relinquishes all rights to transferred assets, agrees that Complaint facts may be taken as true in future proceedings, acknowledges use of its tax ID for collections, and permits the FTC to use paid funds for equitable relief including consumer redress.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Customer Information
provisions.summary: Settling Defendant must provide sufficient customer information to enable the FTC to administer consumer redress, and must supply any requested information within 14 days of a written request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Settling Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within 7 days, deliver copies to key personnel within 7 days (and to future personnel before they assume responsibilities), and obtain signed acknowledgments from all recipients within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Settling Defendant must file a sworn compliance report one year after entry, submit sworn notices within 14 days of structural or contact changes for 10 years, notify the FTC of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days, and submit all required filings by email or overnight courier.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Settling Defendant must create specified records for 10 years and retain each for 5 years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, compliance documentation, and copies of all marketing materials.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Settling Defendant's compliance through written requests for reports and documents, depositions, direct communications with employees, and undercover investigative methods; Settling Defendant must respond within 21 days of written requests.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Data Practices
provisions.summary: Respondents must not misrepresent the extent to which Covered Information is collected, used, disclosed, or shared, or the extent to which users may exercise control over such information.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Geolocation Information Collection Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide clear and prominent disclosures and obtain affirmative express consent before collecting, transmitting, or allowing transmission of geolocation information from mobile applications.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Data Deletion Requirement
provisions.summary: Respondents must delete all Covered Information relating to Affected Consumers that was collected prior to the order's entry date.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondents must maintain and make available to the FTC various documents including advertisements, promotional materials, complaints, and compliance documentation for five years.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondents must deliver a copy of the order to relevant personnel and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt for five years.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Corporate Change Notification (Goldenshores Technologies, LLC)
provisions.summary: Goldenshores Technologies, LLC must notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Individual Employment Change Notification (Erik M. Geidl)
provisions.summary: Erik M. Geidl must notify the Commission of discontinuance of current business or employment, or affiliation with any new business or employment, for ten years.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondents must file compliance reports with the Commission within sixty days and upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The order will terminate on March 31, 2034, or twenty years from the most recent date that a federal complaint alleging violation of the order is filed, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibited Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent and those acting with it must not make any misrepresentation about product reviews or endorsements, including about whether reviews reflect all purchasers' views, whether reviews are unedited, whether reviews are presented regardless of rating, or how reviews factor into overall ratings.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Product Review Display
provisions.summary: Respondent must display all consumer-submitted reviews for products currently for sale on its websites, including previously withheld reviews, subject to limited exceptions for off-topic, unlawful, or inappropriate content.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $4,200,000 to the Commission within 8 days of the effective date of the Order by electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Respondent relinquishes all rights to transferred assets, agrees that complaint facts may be used in future litigation, and acknowledges rules governing use of paid funds, default interest, civil penalties for nonpayment, and reporting of its taxpayer ID.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt to the Commission within 10 days, deliver copies of the Order to relevant personnel within 10 days (and to future personnel before they assume responsibilities), and obtain signed acknowledgments from recipients within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn compliance report 90 days after the Order is issued, and must submit sworn notices within 14 days of any change in contact points, business structure, or bankruptcy filings; all submissions must follow specified formatting and delivery requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create specified records for 10 years and retain each for 5 years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, compliance records, marketing materials, product reviews submitted, and records showing any lack of compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission has broad rights to monitor compliance, including requesting additional reports and records within 10 days, interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using undercover methods without prior notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates 20 years from issuance or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, with limited exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Directing Further Reply
provisions.summary: Respondent Meta Platforms, Inc. is directed to file a reply addressing the legal issues raised by Complaint Counsel's Reply within thirty days of this order.

provisions.title: Ban on Marketing Rental Listings
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently banned from advertising, marketing, promoting, offering, or selling subscriptions for or access to rental listing services, with a limited exception for properties Defendants personally own.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Defendants and all persons acting in concert with them are permanently enjoined from misrepresenting any material aspect of any good or service they advertise or sell, including cost, restrictions, performance, refund/cancellation terms, or any other material fact.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: A judgment of $6,037,686.99 is entered jointly and severally against all Defendants for equitable monetary relief, to be used for consumer redress or deposited to the U.S. Treasury as disgorgement, with Defendants' taxpayer IDs available for collection purposes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within 7 days, deliver copies of the Order to key personnel within 7 days (or before new personnel assume duties), and obtain signed acknowledgments from recipients within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit a sworn compliance report one year after entry of the Order and sworn compliance notices within 14 days of specified changes for 20 years; must also report bankruptcy filings within 14 days, and must submit reports via specified methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendants must create certain records for 20 years after entry of the Order and retain each record for 5 years, covering accounting records, personnel records, and all records demonstrating full compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC has broad authority to monitor compliance, including requesting sworn reports and documents within 14 days, conducting depositions, interviewing affiliated persons, and using undercover methods without prior notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Fake Documents
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently prohibited from advertising, marketing, promoting, offering for sale, or assisting others in doing so with any Fake Document or any service, template, or mechanism for creating one.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Providing Means and Instrumentalities to Deceive Consumers
provisions.summary: Defendants and those acting in concert with them are permanently prohibited from providing others the means to make material misrepresentations about a person's identity, residency, finances, taxes, or employment, or about the authenticity of related documents.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment and Suspension
provisions.summary: A $15,000 monetary judgment is entered jointly and severally against Defendants, but is suspended based on the truthfulness of their sworn financial statements; the suspension will be lifted if material misstatements are found.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendants relinquish all rights to assets transferred under the Order; complaint facts are taken as true in future proceedings; Taxpayer Identification Numbers may be used for collecting delinquent amounts; and payments may be used for consumer redress or deposited to the U.S. Treasury.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must personally acknowledge receipt of the Order within 7 days, deliver copies to relevant personnel within 7 days (and to future personnel before they assume responsibilities), and obtain signed acknowledgments from recipients within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit an annual compliance report one year after entry of the Order, notify the Commission of material changes within 14 days for 20 years, report any bankruptcy filing within 14 days, and comply with specified submission procedures.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendants must create certain records for 20 years and retain each for 5 years, covering accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints and refund requests, and all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC retains broad rights to monitor Defendants' compliance, including requesting additional reports, conducting depositions, obtaining discovery, interviewing employees, posing undercover, and obtaining consumer reports.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Fake Documents
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained and enjoined from advertising, marketing, promoting, or offering for sale any Fake Document or any service, template, or mechanism for creating any Fake Document.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Providing Means and Instrumentalities to Deceive Consumers
provisions.summary: Defendant and all persons acting in concert with her are permanently prohibited from providing others the means to make misrepresentations about any person's identity, residency, finances, taxes, or employment, or the source/authenticity of related documents.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment
provisions.summary: A $169,000 monetary judgment is entered against Defendant but suspended based on the truthfulness of her financial representations; if those representations are found to be false, the full judgment becomes immediately due.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all rights to transferred assets, the Complaint facts are taken as true in subsequent litigation, Defendant acknowledges use of her tax ID numbers for collecting delinquent amounts, and all money paid to the Commission may be used for equitable relief or deposited to the U.S. Treasury.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must personally acknowledge receipt of the Order under penalty of perjury within 7 days, deliver copies to relevant personnel within specified timeframes for 5 years, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn annual compliance report one year after entry and notify the Commission within 14 days of specified changes for 20 years; Defendant must also notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days, and all submissions must follow specified format and delivery requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create certain records for 20 years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for 5 years, covering accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints and refund requests, and all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through additional reports, depositions, document production, direct communications, interviews of affiliated persons, undercover methods, and consumer reporting agency records.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from misrepresenting any material facts about how their file-sharing application operates, including which files will be shared, with whom, and how consumers can control sharing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Required Disclosures and Defaults Relating to the Sharing of Downloaded Files
provisions.summary: Defendants may not distribute any file-sharing application unless it clearly discloses sharing behavior before installation, requires affirmative consumer selection of files to share, and provides easy mechanisms to disable sharing after installation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Requirements Relating to User-Originated Files and Default Settings
provisions.summary: Defendants may not distribute any file-sharing application capable of sharing user-originated files unless sharing of such files can only be enabled after complete installation, with clear disclosures, affirmative consumer selection, and easy mechanisms to reverse sharing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Requirements Regarding Legacy Versions
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from promoting, selling, or distributing any Legacy Version of FrostWire Desktop or FrostWire for Android, and must transmit update code and prominent notices to all computers running Legacy Versions within ten business days of the order's entry.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Defendants' compliance through written reports, document production, depositions, facility inspections, undercover investigations, and employee interviews.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: For three years, Individual Defendant must notify the FTC of changes in residence, employment, and name; all Defendants must notify the FTC of corporate structure changes; Defendants must file a sworn compliance report 60 days after entry; and Defendants must notify the FTC of any bankruptcy filing within 15 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: For six years from entry of this Order, each Defendant must create and retain specified business records, including accounting records, personnel records, complaints, compliance documents, and executable copies of all versions of any file-sharing application they distribute.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: For three years from entry, Defendants must deliver copies of this Order to principals, officers, managers, employees, and agents, and obtain signed and dated acknowledgments of receipt within thirty days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must submit to the Commission a truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of this Order within five business days of receipt of the Order as entered by the Court.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Ban on Use of Information from Sentry
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from disclosing Collected Information to anyone other than Personnel Necessary to Support Sentry or a Registered Sentry User for the sole purpose of accessing that user's account.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Destruction of Collected Information
provisions.summary: Defendant must destroy, within 5 days of entry of the Order, any Collected Information transferred to or available in any database or server used by Pulse, except for information only available to Registered Sentry Users.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must notify the FTC of structural changes for 4 years, submit sworn annual compliance reports starting 60 days after entry, notify of bankruptcy within 15 days, and send all reports by overnight courier or first-class mail with simultaneous electronic copy.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor and investigate Defendant's compliance, including requiring written reports, document production, depositions, and facility access, as well as using discovery procedures and posing as consumers or suppliers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Record-Keeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Defendant must create and retain for seven years specific records related to Sentry and Pulse, including accounting records, personnel records, customer files, complaints, advertising materials, and all documents necessary to demonstrate full compliance with this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: Defendant must deliver copies of the Order to principals, officers, directors, managers, relevant employees, agents, and successor business entities within specified timeframes, and must obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a truthful sworn statement to the FTC acknowledging receipt of this Order within five business days of receiving it.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)
